newsitem.title: HUNGARY: DLR/MARK BASKET DEALS DOMINATE HUNGARY FX FUTURES.
newsitem.headline: DLR/MARK BASKET DEALS DOMINATE HUNGARY FX FUTURES.

text.p: Dollar/mark basket deals dominated Hungary's currency futures markets on Friday, accounting for 98 percent of all turnover.
Basket deals concentrated on the March maturity on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) with the mark falling 0.1 to 119.0 forints and the dollar falling 0.22 to 204.5.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) such deals concentrated on the December maturity, with the mark falling 0.25 to 115.00 forints and the dollar dropping 0.28 to 198.0.

Basket deals, by which dollars and marks are traded in the 30/70 proportion they represent in the central bank's currency basket against which the forint floats, are seen as a way of hedging against large dollar/mark fluctuations.
BCE turnover stood at a large 7.989 billion forints while the smaller BSE registered 1.13 million forints.
